The Bone Snatcher is about a group miners who go on a search for a missing crew of miners in the Namib Desert. When the find them, the crew are found in an area with a mass amount of fossil remains. During an argument between the crew leader, group leader and paleontologist over what to do with the remains, they are attacked by a group of unknown humanoid creatures who seems to be made of bone. That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie in a theater..

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent world. In the end, Tom and Jerry, being walking urban legends, are mistaken as the super-heroes. Their super-powers are found within their bodies. Only Alan (voice of John Belosi) sees through their whimsical behavior.
Micheal Franks<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie is pale by comparison to more enjoyable Disney fairy tales, thanks to the heavy romance in it. I think it will be wrong to refer to this movie with any moniker whose translator is ‘Lonely Girl’. No wonder the movie has achieved its found success.
But love it. Unconditional, always.

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy share their excesses (they are eating dinner for three at a Carnivaltime at Yankee Stadium, under the big overhead brilliant sun) and enjoy arguments about who might represent the 'last Americans,' if they were to choose.
